name: Section VS Vector Spaces - A First Course in Linear Algebralinear.ups.edu › A First Course in Linear Algebra › Vector Spaces
description: A vector space is composed of three objects, a set and two operations. Some would explicitly state in the definition that V must be a nonempty set, but we can infer this from Property Z, since the set cannot be empty and contain a vector that behaves as the zero vector.

name: Vector space - Wikipediaen.wikipedia.org › wiki › Vector_space
description:
Vector spaces are the subject of linear algebra and are well characterized by their dimension, which, roughly speaking, specifies the number of independent directions in the space. Infinite-dimensional vector spaces arise naturally in mathematical analysis as function spaces, whose vectors are functions.
